Package com.nbkelly

Class Command

java.lang.Object
com.nbkelly.Command
Direct Known Subclasses:
AllOrNothingCommand, BooleanCommand, DirectoryCommand, FileCommand, IntCommand, OptionalIntCommand, RegexCommand, SingleChoiceCommand, StringCommand
public abstract class Command
extends Object
A command interprets arguments arrays into variables.

A command interprets arguments arrays into variables. It is capable of self-matching on an argument array, updating the given input, and recognizing errors or duplicate inputs.

Since:
1.0

    • synonyms

      public TreeSet<String> synonyms
      All of the synonyms which can be used to address this command.

      Is this command mandatory?

    • matched

      public int matched
      Number of times this command has been matched

    • repeated

      protected int repeated
      Number of repeat inputs given to this command

    • invalid

      protected int invalid
      Number of invalid inputs given to this command

    • takesInput

      protected boolean takesInput
      Does this command require an input argument?

    • type

      protected String type
      The type of input this command takes (if any). Default is 'generic'.

    • terminal

      protected boolean terminal
      Is this command terminal?

      If a command is terminal, then after it has been matched, no other commands may be matched.

  • Constructor Details

    • Command

      public Command()

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of this command.
      Returns:
      The name of this command.

    • isTerminal

      public boolean isTerminal()
      Is this command terminal?

      A command is terminal if, on being matched, no further input is allowed.

      Returns:
      True is the command is terminal

    • setTerminal

      public <Sneed extends Command> Sneed setTerminal()
      Sets a command to be terminal.

      A command is terminal if, on being matched, no further input is allowed.

      Returns:
      The same command, but terminal

    • addSynonyms

      public Command addSynonyms​(String... args)
      Adds a set of synonyms to this command
      Parameters:
      args - a list of synonyms. They do not need to be unique, but they should not match the synonyms of any other command
      Returns:
      The same command, but with synonyms added

    • setMandatory

      public Command setMandatory​(boolean mandatory)
      Sets the mandatory status of this command

      If a command is mandatory, the program will not run unless it has been specified (and some pretty output will be displayed when you fail to run the program).

      Parameters:
      mandatory - is this command mandatory
      Returns:
      The same command, but with mandatory set.

    • matched

      public boolean matched()
      Has this command matched some input?
      Returns:
      True if this command has matched some input

    • match

      public abstract int match​(String[] argv, int index)
      Given a list of arguments, and an index, attempts to match the argument at this index.
      Parameters:
      argv - the input arguments for the program
      index - the current index of matching
      Returns:
      (new_index gt 0) if there was a match, 0 if there was no match, or -1 if there was an error

    • invalid

      public boolean invalid()
      Returns wether or not the command is invalid.

      A command is invalid if it has been matched more than once, or is mandatory and has not been matched, or if invalid input has been given for the command.

      Returns:
      True if the command is invalid

    • valid

      public boolean valid()
      Returns wether or not the command is valid.

      It is worth noting that valid != -invalid: valid refers to the completion status of multi-part commands (and should probably be renamed for that), and invalid refers to the match status of single-part commands

      Returns:
      True if the command is valid

    • usage

      public String usage​(boolean colorEnabled, boolean suppressMandatory)
      Gets the usage tag for this command, suppressing mandatory text.

      Errors will be highlighted, and it will be noted if mandatory arguments have no been filled. If colorEnabled is true, it will also color pieces where errors have occured.

      Parameters:
      colorEnabled - true if color is enabled
      Returns:
      The usage text of this command

    • usage

      public String usage​(boolean colorEnabled)
      Gets the usage tag for this command.

      Errors will be highlighted, and it will be noted if mandatory arguments have no been filled. If colorEnabled is true, it will also color pieces where errors have occured.

      Parameters:
      colorEnabled - true if color is enabled
      Returns:
      The usage text of this command

    • setName

      public <T extends Command> T setName​(String name)
      Sets the name of a command
      Returns:
      The same command, but named

    • setDescription

      public <T extends Command> T setDescription​(String desc)
      Sets the description on this command
      Returns:
      The same command, but described
